content:
I would recommend some other mexican dishes that are easy to make and require minimal ingredients include:

1. salsa - try making a simple salsa by combining diced tomatoes, chopped onion, cilantro, lime juice, and salt to taste. you can customize the recipe by adding jalapeño or other spices to meet your taste. 2. quesadillas - fill a tortilla with shredded cheese, chopped vegetables, or cooked meats, and cook in a pan until the cheese is melted, and tortilla is crispy. 3. tacos de pollo (chicken tacos) - marinate chicken in lime juice, garlic, chili powder, cumin, salt, and pepper. cook the chicken in a pan and serve on soft corn tortillas with your choice of toppings such as diced onions, cilantro, shredded lettuce, and salsa. 4. churros - a delicious and easy dessert that can be made by mixing flour, sugar, salt, and warm water into a dough, frying it and coating it with cinnamon and sugar. 5. enchiladas - fill tortillas with cooked and shredded chicken or beans, roll them up, and place them in a baking dish with enchilada sauce and cheese. bake in the oven until the cheese is melted. remember to start simple and work your way up to more complex dishes as you gain confidence and experience in the kitchen. good luck and enjoy!
